content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-162-11-B
|Item_parent=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Item_parent_short=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the clinical signs of an upper genital infection in women (salpingitis, endometritis)
|Description=None
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=11}}
- PID:

- +/- fever

- Pelvic pain, metrorrhagia, +/- leucorrhoea

- Gynaecological examination: pain on vaginal touch, endocervical inflammation


- Endometritis: fever +++, increased pelvic pain on VT, discharge from the cervical os

question.title: What are the clinical signs of an upper genital infection in women?

option_a.title: Fever, pelvic pain, and leucorrhoea
option_a.description: A combination of symptoms that may indicate an upper genital infection

option_b.title: Pelvic pain, metrorrhagia, and increased pelvic pain on VT
option_b.description: A combination of symptoms that may indicate an upper genital infection

option_c.title: Endometritis: fever ++++, increased pelvic pain on VT, discharge from the cervical os

option_d.title: All of the above
option_d.description: A combination of all the symptoms listed
